record.description: One of the first to visit the Zero Gradient Synchrotron (ZGS) at Argonne National Laboratory after it achieved its full operating power of 12.5 billion electron volts was Illinois Governor Otto G. Kerner. Governor Kerner was one of the principle speakers September 26 at a Nuclear Applications Conference held at Argonne. In this photograph, Governor Kerner (center) is shown examining the 110-foot linear accelerator (linac) that fires protons at 50 million electron volts into the magnet ring of the ZGS where these are further accelerated to 12.5 BeV. At the left is Dr. Lee C. Teng, Director of Argonne's Particle Accelerator Division. At [the] right is Dr. Roger Hildebrand, Associate Laboratory Director for High Energy Physics.
